00892 enum CmtControlLine {
00893         CMT_CONTROL_DCD         = 0x0001,               // pin 1: Carrier Detect
00894         CMT_CONTROL_RD          = 0x0002,               // pin 2: Received Data
00895         CMT_CONTROL_TD          = 0x0004,               // pin 3: Transmitted Data
00896         CMT_CONTROL_DTR         = 0x0008,               // pin 4: Data Terminal Ready
00897         CMT_CONTROL_GND         = 0x0010,               // pin 5: Common Ground
00898         CMT_CONTROL_DSR         = 0x0020,               // pin 6: Data Set Ready
00899         CMT_CONTROL_RTS         = 0x0040,               // pin 7: Request To Send
00900         CMT_CONTROL_CTS         = 0x0080,               // pin 8: Clear To Send
00901         CMT_CONTROL_RI          = 0x0100                // pin 9: Ring Indicator
00902 };

00922 typedef uint32_t        CmtDeviceId;
00923 
00924 /* different alignment commands for gcc / MSVS, the structure needs to be 2-byte aligned
00925         because the deviceId field is 4 bytes long on offset 98.
00926 */
00927 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00928         #pragma pack(push, 2)
00929 #endif
00931 struct CmtDeviceConfiguration {
00932         uint32_t        m_masterDeviceId;
00933         uint16_t        m_samplingPeriod;
00934         uint16_t        m_outputSkipFactor;
00935         uint16_t        m_syncinMode;
00936         uint16_t        m_syncinSkipFactor;
00937         uint32_t        m_syncinOffset;
00938         uint8_t m_date[8];
00939         uint8_t m_time[8];
00940         uint8_t m_reservedForHost[32];
00941         uint8_t m_reservedForClient[32];
00942         uint16_t        m_numberOfDevices;
00943         struct _devInfo {
00944                 uint32_t        m_deviceId;
00945                 uint16_t        m_dataLength;
00946                 uint16_t        m_outputMode;
00947                 uint32_t        m_outputSettings;
00948                 uint8_t m_reserved[8];
00949         } m_deviceInfo[CMT_MAX_DEVICES_PER_PORT];
00950 
00951 #ifndef _CMT_DLL_IMPORT
00952         void readFromMessage(const void* message);
00953 #endif
00954 }
00955 // different alignment commands for gcc / MSVS
00956 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00957         ;
00958         #pragma pack(pop)
00959 #else
00960         __attribute__((__packed__))     ;
00961 #endif
00962 
00964 
00966 typedef uint32_t CmtOutputMode;
00968 typedef uint64_t CmtOutputSettings;
00969 
00971 struct CmtDataFormat {
00972         CmtOutputMode           m_outputMode;
00973         CmtOutputSettings       m_outputSettings;
00974 
00975 #ifndef _CMT_DLL_IMPORT
00977         CmtDataFormat(  const CmtOutputMode mode = CMT_DEFAULT_OUTPUT_MODE,
00978                                         const CmtOutputSettings settings = CMT_DEFAULT_OUTPUT_SETTINGS)
00979                                         : m_outputMode(mode), m_outputSettings(settings) {}
00980 #endif
00981 };

01172 struct CmtPortInfo {
01173         uint32_t m_baudrate;    
01174         uint32_t m_deviceId;    
01175         uint16_t m_portNr;              
01176         char m_portName[32];            
01177 #ifdef __cplusplus
01178 #       ifdef _WIN32
01180         bool operator > (const CmtPortInfo& p) const { return m_portNr > p.m_portNr; }
01182         bool operator < (const CmtPortInfo& p) const { return m_portNr < p.m_portNr; }
01184         bool operator == (const CmtPortInfo& p) const { return m_portNr == p.m_portNr; }
01186         bool operator == (const uint16_t port) const { return m_portNr == port; }
01187 #       else    // Linux
01189         bool operator > (const CmtPortInfo& p) const { return strcmp(m_portName, p.m_portName) > 0; }
01191         bool operator < (const CmtPortInfo& p) const { return strcmp(m_portName, p.m_portName) < 0; }
01193         bool operator == (const CmtPortInfo& p) const { return strcmp(m_portName, p.m_portName) == 0; }
01195         bool operator == (const uint16_t port) const { return false; }
01196 #       endif // ifdef _WIN32/Linux
01197 #endif
01198 };
